intro: Sisymbrium elegans var. juniperorum, commonly known as juniper hill peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. This variety is distinguished by its association with juniper woodlands, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
